sentences.en: As he drew abreast of the man he pretended to stumble.
sentences.cn: 当他赶上那个男人时，他装出了要跌倒的样子。

sentences.en: Don't stumble, you heedless little thing.
sentences.cn: 别绊倒, 你这个粗心的小东西.

sentences.en: I loved you enough to let you stumble, fall, hurt and fail.
sentences.cn: 我爱你至深才让你蹒跚学步, 品尝跌倒 、 受伤和失败的滋味.

sentences.en: I make it into the darkness with only one stumble.
sentences.cn: 我只是绊了一下，周围就变成了一片黑暗。

sentences.en: I tumble and stumble as if on way of exile.
sentences.cn: 余暴跌和失败如对流亡的方式.

sentences.en: I walked up one road , down another , expecting to stumble on something recognizable.
sentences.cn: 我东投西奔, 指望撞见认得的东西.

sentences.en: If you stumble across the book, keep it for me.
sentences.cn: 如果你碰巧看到那本书, 就给我留下.

sentences.en: If your timing is right, you may be fortunate enough to stumble across a village fiesta.
sentences.cn: 如果你时机把握得好，你会幸运地撞上某个乡村节日。

sentences.en: In her hurry, she stumbled and spilled the milk all over the floor.
sentences.cn: 匆忙中她绊了一下，把牛奶洒得满地都是。

sentences.en: It is better to stumble than not to start.
sentences.cn: 因为走路而摔跤,总比站在那里不动还要强些.
人有错手, 马有失蹄.

sentences.en: NIV My enemies turn back; they stumble and perish before you.
sentences.cn: [和合]我的仇敌转身退去的时候, 他们一见你的面,就跌倒灭亡.

sentences.en: Stagger and stumble suggest unsteady or uncontrolledmovement.
sentences.cn: stagger和stumble均指不稳的或身不由己的动作.

sentences.en: The engine will not run well with a lean mixture and may stumble or stall.
sentences.cn: 使用稀薄的混合气,发动机将不能很好地运转,并会出现加速后坐现象或失速停车现象.

sentences.en: The sudden weakness in her legs made her stumble.
sentences.cn: 她突然两腿发软踉跄了一下。

sentences.en: You never knew when you might stumble across some new talent.
sentences.cn: 谁也说不准什么时候会碰上一位新的天才.

words.tran_cn: 绊跌者；有过失者；结结巴巴说话者；令人迷惑之事

phrases.tran_cn: 无意中发现；偶然遇到，碰巧找到

trans.tran_en: to hit your foot against something or put your foot down awkwardly while you are walking or running, so that you almost fall
to hit your foot against something or put your foot down awkwardly while you are walking or running, so that you almost fall

trans.tran_cn: 跌跌撞撞地走，蹒跚，结巴，弄错，失足，偶然碰见
trans.tran_en: to stop or make a mistake when you are reading to people or speaking
